refnamediv.refpurpose: show configuration information or log file contents for a virtual machine

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The VBoxManage showvminfo command outputs configuration information or log file contents for a specified virtual machine (VM).

refsect2.title: Viewing Virtual Machine Information
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage showvminfo command outputs information about the specified VM in a detailed format or in a machine-readable format.
The VBoxManage showvminfo command shows the same information for the specified VM in the same format as the VBoxManage list vms --long command.

listitem.para: Includes detailed information about the VM.
Specifies that the VM information be in a machine-readable format.
Specifies password id of the VM if it is encrypted.
Specifies password of the VM if it is encrypted. Either specify the absolute pathname of a password file on the host operating system, or - to prompt you for the password.

refsect2.title: Viewing Virtual Machine Log Contents
refsect2.para: The VBoxManage showvminfo --log command outputs the contents of one of the specified VM's log files.

listitem.para: Specifies a numerical index that identifies the log file.

The index value starts at 0, which indicates the VBox.log file. An index value of 1 indicates the VBoxHardening.log file. Index values starting at 2 indicate other log files, such as the VBox.log.1 file.
Specifies password id of the VM if it is encrypted.
Specifies password of the VM if it is encrypted. Either specify the absolute pathname of a password file on the host operating system, or - to prompt you for the password.

refsect1.title: Examples
refsect1.para: The following example shows typical output for this command:
refsect1.screen:
$ VBoxManage showvminfo "Windows 10" VirtualBox Command Line Management Interface Version version-number Copyright (C) 2005-2024 Oracle and/or its affiliates
Name: Windows 10 Groups: / Guest OS: Windows 10 (64-bit) UUID: 1bf3464d-57c6-4d49-92a9-a5cc3816b7e7 Config file: /home/username/VirtualBox VMs/Windows 10/Windows 10.vbox Snapshot folder: /home/username/VirtualBox VMs/Windows 10/Snapshots Log folder: /home/username/VirtualBox VMs/Windows 10/Logs Hardware UUID: 1bf3464d-57c6-4d49-92a9-a5cc3816b7e7 Memory size: 2048MB Page Fusion: off VRAM size: 12MB CPU exec cap: 100% ...
refsect1.para: The following example shows the information output in a machine-readable format, which shows the entries as a property=value string:
The following example shows the contents of the VBox.log log file:
refsect1.screen: $ VBoxManage showvminfo "Windows 10" --log 0 00:00:02.895106 VirtualBox VM 6.0.0_RC1 r127378 linux.amd64 (Dec 10 2018 17:16:06) release log 00:00:02.895109 Log opened 2018-12-14T14:31:44.088259000Z 00:00:02.895111 Build Type: release 00:00:02.895115 OS Product: Linux 00:00:02.895117 OS Release: 4.1.12-61.1.22.el7uek.x86_64 00:00:02.895119 OS Version: #2 SMP Fri Dec 2 09:28:44 PST 2016 ...
